>
> "We changed Azirs passive because it gave too much benefit for building cooldown reduction." 

Who said that out of curiosity? Our intent with the Azir Passive/W change was to take power out of the early part of his mid game so he didn't spike as hard. It wasn't because champions getting additional benefit from certain stats was something we felt was inherently flawed. 

If we needed to nerf Yasuo in that same time window a similar approach might be appropriate, that's not the case at present though.
I was rather sad to see azir's passive go though. It was pretty unique.

I don't understand why are people crying about Yasuo. He is hard to play. Yes, he is stronger than most mid laners 1-3lvl, but then most midlaners become stronger, until Yasuo gets his first core item.
People may think that his mobility is waaay too much, but he needs it. He's an ADC. People complain about Vayne, but remember that she gets a bodyguard. Yasuo doesn't.
Melee champions have it hard in lane against ranged. Yasuo just has it better.

She gets a bodyguard, cc, and given it's a small roll, but it's on a fairly low cooldown and is not decided by minion waves. Nonetheless I won't _compare_ the two champions, but you're damn right when you say they fall into the same category and one has a lot more unconditional self peel than the other. Dashing on the enemy minions is more frequently than not going to land you at the enemy tower. You don't always want that.
